entry.title: Side panels aren't opening on cloud top / remote desktop
entry.content:
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
Note: This issue is likely due to animation being disabled on remote desktop connections.
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Open new tab page (2) Click on the customize Chrome button
What is the expected result? Customize Chrome side panel shows up
What happens instead? Customize Chrome doesn't show up, though the toolbar icon appears.

entry.title: paint_op_raster_fuzzer: Timeout in paint_op_raster_fuzzer
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=4850677026062336
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: paint_op_raster_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_asan Platform Id: linux

entry.title: Support WebNN API validation tests run on all backends
entry.content:
Current WebNN API validation tests are only run for the XNNPACK backend, we need support run them for all backend.
This request was raised at the CL reviewing on https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5354988. Thanks @asully@chromium.org!

entry.title: 100ms delay between pointermove events
entry.content:
Android device name: Pixel 8
Android OS version: 14
Android System WebView version: 123.0.6312.99
Application: any
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/clever-shape-8ppngt in a webview (e.g. send it to yourself via Messenger) 2. Drag a few times
Expected result: 16-17ms delay
Actual result: 16-100ms delay (avg ~50ms)
Did this work before? (last working WebView version, or N/A) Unsure
Additional info: This issue doesn't occur in Chrome.
I found this issue when I noticed my gestures often lagged for the first frame. E.g. for a swipe gesture, the animation wouldn't begin until ~100ms after you start swiping. I'm using @use-gesture, also created an issue here: https://github.com/pmndrs/use-gesture/issues/662

entry.title: Google Meets wont work in Chrome despite having permissions and being up todate
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome 2. Create Google Meets meeting (either instant, and scheduled) 3. Try to join
# Problem Description Google Meets loads the join page for a second or two, but before you can click join the page refreshes and says 'aw snap' citing error code 5. Reloading from that page replicates the same issue until you see the 'send feedback page' where it suggests that I try incognito (doesn't work) restart chrome (doesn't work) restart computer (doesn't work) or close all other tabs (doesn't work). I've even gone so far as to manually ensure Chrome is up to date, my cookies/browsing history is totally deleted, and still nothing works.
# Additional Comments Permissions are enabled for Chrome for both microphone and camera
# Summary Google Meets wont work in Chrome despite having permissions and being up todate
# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? The whole browser
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: inset-area not flipping as expected
entry.content:
URL: https://codepen.io/una/pen/jOJRpMz
Code being tested: ``` inset-area: bottom; position-try-options: flip-block; ```
The second tooltip initially positions itself above the text as expected. However, it should flip when there isn't enough available space, but it does not. When I use `top: anchor(bottom);` for positioning instead of `inset-area: bottom`, it flips as expected, so I think this is a bug in how `inset-area` is interacting with `position-try-options`.

entry.title: Tests are failing: lens_webui_browsertest.cc(74): Value of: RunTestOnWebContents(web_contents, file, trigger, true)\n Actual: false (Mocha test failures detected in f...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): lens_webui_browsertest.cc(74): Value of: RunTestOnWebContents(web_contents, file, trigger, true)\n Actual: false (Mocha test failures detected in file: lens/overlay/region_selection_test.js, triggered by 'mocha.run()')\nExpected: true
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/LensOverlayTest.ManualRegionSelection
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/f6593f447632b1856c068dbc10f4d771

entry.title: Upgrade instrumented libraries from Focal to Noble
entry.content: This is a tracking issue for the bi-annual instrumented libraries upgrade. The latest Ubuntu LTS is releasing this month (24.04 Noble). The plan is to upgrade from 20.04 (past 22.04) to 24.04.

entry.title: roll libc++ again
entry.content:
We're kinda behind.
Issues:
* https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/github.com/llvm/llvm-project/libcxx.git/+/e3b94d0e5b86883fd77696bf10dc33ba250ba99b (2 revs after our currently pinned version) remove <queue> and <stack> includes from <format>. That apparently needs some cleanups. (Not quite clear why, we probably don't include <format> -- but maybe other libc++ headers do?)
* https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/86843 (10 or so revs newer than our pinned version) moved an include_next before the system header pragma, causing a "this is an extension" warning all over the place. I commented on the upstream PR.

entry.title: conformance/extensions/ext-blend-minmax.html segfaulting on Pixel 6 devices
entry.content:
Starting in [this build](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Android%20FYI%20Release%20(Pixel%206)/13165/infra), `conformance/extensions/ext-blend-minmax.html` has been consistently segfaulting on Pixel 6 devices:
``` I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main tombstone_11 created on 2024-04-08 22:52:00, about this long ago: 0:02:37 Device: 17261FDF6000LQ I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main Build fingerprint: 'google/oriole/oriole:13/TP1A.220624.021/eng.hypan.20221031.175238:userdebug/dev-keys' I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main Revision: 'PVT1.0' I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main pid: 24486, tid: 24504, name: CrGpuMain >>> org.chromium.chrome:privileged_process0 <<< I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR), fault addr 0x0000000000000000 I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main Stack Trace: I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main RELADDR FUNCTION FILE:LINE I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000000000000 <unknown> I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000003f43378 rx::StateManagerGL::setBlendEquations(gl::BlendStateExt const&) ../../third_party/angle/src/libANGLE/renderer/gl/StateManagerGL.cpp:1491:21 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000003f44a38 rx::StateManagerGL::syncState(gl::Context const*, angle::BitSetT<64ul, unsigned long, unsigned long> const&, angle::BitSetT<64ul, unsigned long, unsigned long> const&, angle::BitSetT<11ul, unsigned int, unsigned long> const&, angle::BitSetT<11ul, unsigned int, unsigned long> const&) ../../third_party/angle/src/libANGLE/renderer/gl/StateManagerGL.cpp:2076:17 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000003f0ce1c rx::ContextGL::syncState(gl::Context const*, angle::BitSetT<64ul, unsigned long, unsigned long>, angle::BitSetT<64ul, unsigned long, unsigned long>, angle::BitSetT<11ul, unsigned int, unsigned long>, angle::BitSetT<11ul, unsigned int, unsigned long>, gl::Command) ../../third_party/angle/src/libANGLE/renderer/gl/ContextGL.cpp:895:42 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main v------> gl::Context::syncAllDirtyBits(gl::Command) ../../third_party/angle/src/libANGLE/Context.inl.h:102:5 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main v------> gl::Context::prepareForDraw(gl::PrimitiveMode) ../../third_party/angle/src/libANGLE/Context.inl.h:139:12 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main v------> gl::Context::drawArrays(gl::PrimitiveMode, int, int) ../../third_party/angle/src/libANGLE/Context.inl.h:151:5 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000009a56bbc GL_DrawArrays ../../third_party/angle/src/libGLESv2/entry_points_gles_2_0_autogen.cpp:1260:22 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 000000000995309c gl::GLApiBase::glDrawArraysFn(unsigned int, int, int) ../../ui/gl/gl_bindings_autogen_gl.cc:3894:3 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 000000000a7f5520 gpu::gles2::GLES2DecoderPassthroughImpl::DoDrawArrays(unsigned int, int, int) ../../gpu/command_buffer/service/gles2_cmd_decoder_passthrough_doers.cc:1226:10 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 000000000a7e5128 gpu::error::Error gpu::gles2::GLES2DecoderPassthroughImpl::DoCommandsImpl<false>(unsigned int, void const volatile*, int, int*) ../../gpu/command_buffer/service/gles2_cmd_decoder_passthrough.cc:737:20 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000009fbc014 gpu::CommandBufferService::Flush(int, gpu::AsyncAPIInterface*) ../../gpu/command_buffer/service/command_buffer_service.cc:232:35 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 000000000a973230 gpu::CommandBufferStub::OnAsyncFlush(int, unsigned int, std::__Cr::vector<gpu::SyncToken, std::__Cr::allocator<gpu::SyncToken>> const&) ../../gpu/ipc/service/command_buffer_stub.cc:507:22 ```
The suspected culprit is https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/angle/angle/+/5415033 since it seems relevant to the extension being tested and it touches one of the files in the stack. Assigning to the CL author.
I will suppress the failures while this is investigated.

entry.title: WPT deleteAllCookies seems to not clear FedCM data
entry.content:
This test is failing: https://wpt.fyi/results/credential-management/fedcm-login-status-unknown.https.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned
This likely means that the deleteAllCookies call added in https://crrev.com/c/5403249 does not actually clear FedCM data. We should make it do that, to match the behavior of a user clearing cookies through the UI.
